noun.description: A league or group of five cities or towns; (frequently with capital initial) any of several historical groups or federations of five cities, often including the regions and provinces around them.

origin: Old English; earliest use found in Old English Martyrology. From post-classical Latin pentapolis a league or group of five cities or towns (Vulgate, Wisdom 10:6) from ancient Greek πεντάπολις from πεντα- + πόλις.
